info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:50AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, southeastern Franklin and northwestern Essex Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 350 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Adirondack Regional Airport, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saranac Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Lake Placid, Wawbeek, Harrietstown, Paul Smiths, Union Falls, Saranac Inn, Ray Brook, Lake Colby, Rainbow Lake, Gabriels, Lake Clear, Upper Saint Regis, Onchiota, St. Regis Mountain, Vermontville, Franklin Falls, Alder Brook and Upper St. Regis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
